author: lgo
msg: Follow up to r23757: fix a test failure in get_path_ancestor_length on posix
platforms.
* subversion/libsvn_subr/path.c
(get_path_ancestor_length): small change in the order of how the path cases
are handled.

author: lundblad
msg: On the sparse-directories branch: make the depth
parameter to the set-path and link-path ra_svn protocol commands non-optional.
NOTE: In a sense, this parameter is still "optional" because the parameter
list may end before it.  However, if a client wants to put parameters after
depth (which might be added in the future), they have to specify a depth.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_svn/protocol (3.1.3): Make depth non-optional
for the commands that take a depth.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_svn/client.c
(ra_svn_set_path): Remove parens around depth parameter.  (And don't
flush stdout, BTW;)
(ra_svn_link_path): Remove parens around depth parameter.
* svnserve/serve.c (set_path, link_path): Make depth non-optional.

author: ehu
msg: Followup to (quite botched) r21723: correctly update timestamps in 'entries'.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/log.c (log_do_committed): After installing the
text base, start checking the real text base instead of the temp path.
Also eliminate dead code left after code-reordering. Next to that,
files should be considered modified if the sizes are *not* the same.
Found by: lundblad

author: lundblad
msg: On the sparse-directories branch: TODO changes.
* README.branch:
Document that we're not changing recurse to depth for certain report-related
calls.

author: lgo
msg: Fix for issue #2739: avoid aborting when committing in a working copy on the
root of a drive, don't try to lock the parent folder of '/'.
* subversion/libsvn_subr/path.c
(get_path_ancestor_length): make '/' the shared common part of '/folder1' and
'/folder2'
* subversion/tests/libsvn_subr/path-test.c
(test_get_longest_ancestor): add test case for above scenario
